title: Normal Distribution: Giganticville
question_text:
The distribution of heights of $4\text{-year-old boys}$ in the town of Giganticville is approximately normally distributed with a mean of $78.0$ inches and standard deviation of $4.3\text{ inches}$.
Manute, a $4\text{-year-old-boy}$ from Giganticville has a height that is $0.23$ standard deviations below the mean. His $4\text{-year-old-boy}$ neighbor Mugsy is at the $45^\text{th}$ percentile of the height distribution.
What percentile is Manute's height, and how does his height compare to Mugsy's height?

choices.text: Manute's height is at the $41^\text{st}$ percentile of the distribution, and he is shorter than Mugsy.
Manute's height is at the $41^\text{st}$ percentile of the distribution, and he is the taller than Mugsy.
Manute's height is at the $46^\text{th}$ percentile of the distribution, and he is shorter than Mugsy.
Manute's height is at the $59^\text{th}$ percentile of the distribution, and he is shorter than Mugsy.
Manute's height is at the $59^\text{th}$ percentile of the distribution, and he is taller than Mugsy.

solution:
First, let us find what percentile Manute's height is. Since Manute's height is $0.23$ standard deviations below the mean, we are looking to find the P ($z < -0.23$). Since we have the z-score, then the mean, $\mu $, is represented by $0$ and the standard deviation, $\sigma$, is represented by $1$.

The lower value is $-9999999$ as in a normal distribution curve the tails go off to infinity. The upper value will be $-0.23$ as this is the z-score for Manute's height.

By pressing enter, we can see Choice 'A' is our answer as Manute is at the $41$st percentile, compared to Mugsy being at the $45$th percentile.

Using Table A

Using Table A, locate $-0.2$ in the left-hand column and $0.03$ in the top row. Find where those values intersect. The corresponding entry is $0.4090$.

Manute being in the $41$ percentile represents he is taller than $41$% of $4$-year old boys-from Giganticville compare to Mugsy who is taller than $45$% of $4$-year old boys from Giganticville.

Choice 'A' is our answer.

Explanation of Distractors Choice 'B' is incorrect because Manute is shorter than Mugsy based on their percentiles. Choice 'C' is incorrect because the percentile is incorrect and even if $46$ was the correct percentile this would mean Manute would be taller than Mugsy. Choices 'D' and 'E' are incorrect because the $59th$ percentile represents the height for someone $0.23$ standard deviations above the mean.
